gasp.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
gasp.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: ‘My leg!’ he gasped. ‘I think it’s broken!’
Ollie gasped with pain and slumped forward.
The audience gasped at the splendour of the costumes.
gasp.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to breathe quickly in a way that can be heard because you are having difficulty breathing
gasp.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Brendan climbed slowly, gasping for breath.
gasp.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: when you take in a breath suddenly in a way that can be heard, especially because you are surprised or in pain
gasp.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She gave a little gasp and clutched George’s hand.
With a gasp of pure horror, Lewis jumped up and ran.
gasp.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: when you breathe in air quickly because you are having difficulty breathing
gasp.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Her breath came in shallow gasps.
